alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morris, central Sussex and northeastern Warren Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Five Points, or near Newton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Hopatcong, Blairstown, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, Andover, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Five Points, Green Pond, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Highland Lake and Lake Telemark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
